title: How to Open DGN Files in AutoCAD on PC or Mac

steps.title: Open AutoCAD.
steps.content: Open AutoCAD. It's the app that has an icon with a red capital "A".

steps.title: Click A ⏷.
steps.content: Click A ⏷ . It's the button with a red capital "A" in the top-left corner. This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Hover the mouse over Open.
steps.content: Hover the mouse over Open . It's the second option at the top of the Application menu. It's next to an image of an open folder. This will expand another drop-down menu to the right.

steps.title: Click DGN.
steps.content: Click DGN . It's at the bottom of the menu next to the image of a piece of paper with a blue arrow. This will open a new window to select your file.

steps.title: Select the DGN file.
steps.content: Select the DGN file. Use the browse window to navigate to a DGN file and select it.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's located in the lower-right corner of the browse menu. This will open up an import settings window.

steps.title: Select a design model and conversion options.
steps.content: Select a design model and conversion options. Select a design model from the box on the left and select any other import options you would like, such as choosing a Mapping Setup, or altering the Layer, Linetype, Lineweight, or Color options.

steps.title: Click Ok.
steps.content: Click Ok . This will open the DGN file in AutoCAD after converting it to the DWG format.
